Review title: A lukewarm script somehow stays alive because it does not go to crap level.
Review_body:
Meenakshi Sundareshwar (2021) :
Movie Review -We have seen lots of films made on long distance relationships in Bollywood but Meenakshi Sundareshwar is different for one big reason. Have we seen any film made on long distance relationship set in post marriage scenario? Probably No. That's where Meenakshi Sundareshwar is different and that's the most interesting thing about it. The story is a mix of modern thoughts of young generation and traditional features followed by a typical family, which makes it amusing sometimes but mostly boring.The film is about newly married couple Sundareshwar (Abhimanyu Dassani) and Meenakshi (Sanya Malhotra) and their complex relationship torn by long distance bonding. Meenakshi and Sundar are in love but their personal ambitions somehow makes it difficult for them to live together. The screenplay looks stretched because the story does not have anything as big as to carry a long narrative of 140 minutes. The soul of the story was good enough to make a two hours film, but here those extra 40 minutes makes it lose the grip. Rest, there is nothing much wrong, nothing new either. The idea is loyal and sweet which makes it watchable but at the same time some vulgar, youth oriented jokes harms it.The film is led by Abhimanyu and Sanya mostly because the supporting cast is too big to fit into long space. Abhimanyu Dassani looks good, i mean i didn't hate him much here. His language, the accent, those expresions in tense scenes everything seems reasonable. Sanya, on the other side, runs a riot of her own. That carefree and happy-go-lucky girl is very well played by her. You'll love her in those Thalaiva mimicry scenes and dance scenes. Like mentioned above, the supporting cast is too big but everyone does pretty enough according to roles and situations.Meenakshi Sundareshwar has too many songs unnecessarily added in the final cut. Not that the songs are bad, they are decent but that hampers the pace of the film. Nevertheless, Justin Prabhakaran's music is good enough to play on your jukebox. The technical aspects of the film aren't noteworthy and viewing the film on small screen or mobile phone adds more to its lowering. What works in the film is simplicity of the character and the flow of storytelling. What it lacks is the pace and that little boost of intelligent writing in the conclusion part. The conflicts are outdated. The characters who are supposed to be matured behave immaturely and therefore all the conflicts look bad.Director Vivek Soni has handled the script without making any big damages. To keep that natural flow of relationship was very much needed and he knew exactly what to do. However, he fails to do something new which makes this one a forgettable affair. As a whole, Meenakshi Sundareshwar is sweet but it has limits to its own lukewarm vision. They don't want cross the boundaries and make a film that will stand tall against mediocrity hence, fails to make an impact. It's still watchable and i think that's too much to ask from a dustbin called Netflix.RATING - 5/10*

Review title: Post marriage uneasy period of adjustment
Review_body:
A newly wed south Indian couple is forced to carry on a long distance relationship as hubby has to move from orthodox temple town Madurai to a happening, modern cyber city Bengaluru. The sweet nothings through the lap top does not help to keep the relationship live. There are the usual strict elder males and curious aunties. To make things worse, the IT firm in the big bad Bengaluru city where our hero( Abimanyu Dasani) works, accepts only bachelors due to heavy and time sensitive work load. ( The super strict boss makes this amply clear in his speech to the rookies). The new bride ( Sanya Malhotra) makes unsuccessful efforts to join him and soon the misunderstandings and the friction begin. When the communication between them breaks down he ruefully says that "communication is like oxygen in a relationship".This movie is a case of post marriage slow burn and uneasy period of adjustment which at times tests the patience of audience with its slow pace, sweetness and excessive simplicity. Yes excessive sweetness and simplicity can be a pain at times. The movie focusses a bit too much on the orthodox south Indian family and the atmosphere of the sleepy temple town of Madurai to a point of distraction. The narrative is painfully slow most of the time and the misery of the confused, timid ,and awkward couple does not help in any way. (At times it looks like an idli- sambar mix gone wrong.)
The good point of the movie is the pleasing display of romance between a pretty heroine and a handsome shy hero, both trying desperately to make the marriage work. The aspect of Sanya being a crazy and diehard fan of Rajnikanth is shown very well. The movie has lovely music and excellent cinematography which brings out Madurai beautifully.

Review title: Easy watch movie with great performance from Sanya Malhotra and Abhimanyu
Review_body: Meenakshi Sundareshwar is one of those easy to watch movies which is does not gets too intense at any point of time. While some of the scenes are over the top and hard to believe but I can pass those in the name of creative freedom.Set in Madurai, this movie showcases the struggles which a newly married couple sometimes have to go through in coping up with a long distance relationship, especially at the beginning of their married life in an arranged marriage scenario.The beauty of this movie lies in its simple narrative where none of the emotions are overemphasized. Sanya Malhotra has been building a fine body of work with very different kinds of roles and Meenakshi Sundareshwar is another feather in her cap. She is emotive and confident throughout her portrayal of Meenakshi who is a well educated and family oriented girl from Madurai, and is also very clear about her choices and expectations in life.Abhimanyu also portrays the role of a fresher software engineer who is shy but confident in his own right. He pulls off the role of Sundareshwar effortlessly.Both of them share a good chemistry in this film around a newly married couple who are in love with each other but are sometimes disturbed due to some situations.Overall this is a good movie with some great performances. Do watch if you feel like watching something light.P. S. - some people have been commenting about families in Tamil Nadu speaking in Hindi and how it is not right. My thoughts are that rather than looking at the Hindi, think of it as bollywood's attempt at showcasing south indian way of life in a beautiful manner. There are ample scenarios in Tamil movies as well wherein a north Indian character is shown speaking Tamil, which is ok. So please chill and enjoy the movie.

Review title: A pure cringefest , shallow , illogical baseless so called romantic movie
Review_body:
The term 'love ' or 'romance" can be shown in such pathetic way , those who haven't watched this movie will not understand that .After watching the trailer of this movie I was really intrigued and looking forward to watch this movie thinking it to be something special or thinking that finally I will watch a good romantic movie that will take my heart away .But after finally watching the movie on netflix totally disappointed . I have never watched such cringy , stupid , illogical , baseless and soulless romantic movie .The story follows marriage of two strangers Meenakshi and Sundareshwar and after that how Sundareshwar has to go to Bangalore for his job as a result of which how both have to live in a long distance relationship and what challenges do both have to face as a result of being in long distance relationship .First of all I myself did not see any challenge or maybe to be precise I would say the situations or things shown in this movie I could not consider them as challenge because those situations or things were too illogical , cringeworthy and baseless and not so believable .The romance shown between both was so shallow , dull lacking depth completely .It never felt that these two are even couples or they love each other
Both Sanya Malhotra and Abhimanyu at times became too irritating to watch on screen especially Abhimanyu as Sundareshwar was much irritating than Sanya Malhotra .The climax shown too was so cheesy and illogical that we have already seen in many movies before .And I don't know why did they gave so much importance to Rajnikant in this movie .Finally I would like to say this is a very bad movie , only those who like cringy stuff can definitely watch it, otherwise others I would not recommend to watch this even for once .I'm still giving 2 stars because of a song which comes in the later part of 2nd half . That song and the scenes that go with the song are good Otherwise this movie deserves 0 stars.

Review title: Heartwarming and wholesome acting but, the middle and ending was boring.
Review_body: As always, Sanya Malhotra's Acting is impeccable. She perfectly portrays the challenges of adapting to a joint household and newlywed struggles.The film kick starts itself well. The love between the new couple is felt through the screen. Because the couple was married traditionally through an arranged marriage, it shows their journey on how they formed their love organically, grew through their challenges of a long-distance marriage and typical traditional family interference.The pros: I enjoyed how the location and culture were captured through the scenes. Viewing the scenery, attire, and history of religion was enjoyable. Lastly, I appreciated when Sanya stood up for herself when being accused of being unfaithful and having her character questioned.The cons: I did not appreciate how the middle became a bit dull, songs were not memorable, and the ending was rushed. My BIGGEST con would be how quickly she forgave her husband. Of course, both husband and wife worked hard to make their marriage worthwhile, and they had different circumstances. However, the wife had undergone a lot of stress with adjusting to a new family, was told she could not work due to a grandson needing her to tutor him... Etc. She was publicly humiliated by her husband when she tried to surprise him, and she left for space. Her husband caught her in a good mood where she was happy, and because of that, she forgave him. This scene should have been worked out longer instead of catching his wife on a good day.Long story short, it's not a bad movie but Also, not impressive.

Review title: Terrible script and worse plot. This is just the beginning to being an insult to movies.
Review_body: A IT company that has a policy to not hire married people? How would such a company be allowed to exist?!The company gives out jobs based on a fully developed and operational app. If someone is capable enough to do this, why would they need the job??!Nothing in this movie makes sense.Stereotyping South Indians in so many ways.Why were North Indian actors hired for South Indian roles when there are perfectly capable actors in the South who can speak Hindi?The director could have easily had the plot around a North Indian household and the plot would make no difference.The movie has as major plot holes. Such as the lead character mentions his wife to the people giving him a job and everybody conveniently forgets about it.Giving this movie 2 stars is being generous.This movie has been given fake ratings on IMDB such that it can get more revenue. Beware of all the fake reviews on this. This is Karan Johar propaganda.Do not fall for it.

Review title: Good act by sanya and others , few funny scnens but bad and ignorant script
Review_body: First 30 minutes look exciting and intresting, movie start getting wierd after the day of wedding. Getting an engineering job letter which asks to join next day, then a company which appears more like an engineering college and wacky rules (company prefers only bachelors), none of this was convincing and I personally couldn't take it, but chose to ignore for sake of trying to complete the movie. Later weird (filmy and fantasy) situations and weird songs make it worse. Couldn't complete. Few bits were funny indeed though.

Sanya malhotra is the only one that made this movie watchable. A company that does not hire married people? Going long distance for such an internship did not even make sense. Everything felt so male dominated, why is she the only one sacrificing everything for him? What is his contribution? Why only his career is important, what about her dreams, her career. No this movie just did not strike a chord with me. Very poor script. I am exhausted listening to the word 'long distance' and the glorified version of its struggle.

They want to make a Bollywood movie which is based on two Tamil families but they don't speak Tamil except for sentence endings with Tamil words to remind the viewer the setting is in Madurai.Imagine how it would feel watching a movie with a cast of Tamil speaking actors and the plot happens in Maharashtra with Marathi families but they only speak Tamil except a few Marathi words. Sounds awful isn't it? That's how I felt.It is worth mentioning the scene where Sundar's dad visits his office, he asks did he see anyone wearing a lungi. His dad was wearing a veshti! Even the basics are wrong and everyone always wears a lungi! For god's sake, grow up Bollywood. The actors have tried to give their best but the whole premise is wrong so everything e goes under the water. Just a humble request;please don't attempt such half baked incomplete portrayals in the future.
